briefTitle: Clinical Trial of Sodium Nitrite for Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest
officialTitle: Randomized Clinical Trial of Sodium Nitrite for Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest
summary: In this clinical study, a total of 1500 patients with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest in Seattle/King County will be enrolled. This will be a randomized clinical trial and patients will receive either two different doses of IV sodium nitrite (45 mg or 60 mg) or placebo during resuscitation in the field by paramedics. The primary outcome will be proportion of patients surviving to hospital admission.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Survived to Hospital Admission
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: within 24 hours after out of hospital cardiac arrest
